response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (18 years old)", "high", "Being very young is associated with higher risk as younger individuals statistically have a higher likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Gender (Female)", "low", "Females generally have lower recidivism rates compared to males, reducing the overall risk."],
    ["Race (White)", "medium", "White individuals are not typically overrepresented in recidivism statistics, suggesting an average contribution."],
    ["Arrest History (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A single arrest without conviction indicates some interaction with criminal justice but limited criminal behavior."],
    ["Height/Weight (5'10\", 150-174 lbs)", "low", "Physical attributes such as height and weight have little to no influence on recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status (Never married; Living alone)", "medium", "Being unmarried and living alone can be associated with reduced social support which may marginally elevate risk."],
    ["Educational Attainment (No high school diploma or GED)", "high", "Lack of formal education is a significant risk factor, as it is closely linked to socioeconomic disadvantages and higher recidivism."],
    ["Employment (Held 2 jobs during the year)", "low", "Having employment, even if limited, suggests some degree of social stability, reducing risk."],
    ["Drug Use (None in last four years)", "low", "Absence of drug use is a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (No depression over the past month)", "low", "Good current mental health reduces the likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Family and Environment (Lived with biological mother in an urban household of 4)", "medium", "An urban upbringing can expose individuals to criminogenic environments, though family living with a parent is somewhat stabilizing."],
    ["Religious Belief (Considers that God has nothing to do with her personal outcomes)", "medium", "A lack of religious or spiritual engagement might mean fewer community or social supports, slightly increasing risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being very young is associated with higher risk as younger individuals statistically have a higher likelihood of recidivism.
Females generally have lower recidivism rates compared to males, reducing the overall risk.
White individuals are not typically overrepresented in recidivism statistics, suggesting an average contribution.
A single arrest without conviction indicates some interaction with criminal justice but limited criminal behavior.
Physical attributes such as height and weight have little to no influence on recidivism risk.
Being unmarried and living alone can be associated with reduced social support which may marginally elevate risk.
Educational Attainment (No high school diploma or GED)
Lack of formal education is a significant risk factor, as it is closely linked to socioeconomic disadvantages and higher recidivism.
Having employment, even if limited, suggests some degree of social stability, reducing risk.
Drug Use (None in last four years)
Absence of drug use is a protective factor against recidivism.
Mental Health (No depression over the past month)
Good current mental health reduces the likelihood of recidivism.
Family and Environment (Lived with biological mother in an urban household of 4)
An urban upbringing can expose individuals to criminogenic environments, though family living with a parent is somewhat stabilizing.
Religious Belief (Considers that God has nothing to do with her personal outcomes)
A lack of religious or spiritual engagement might mean fewer community or social supports, slightly increasing risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. She is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. She has never been married and is currently living alone. She does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. She has held 2 jobs during the year. She has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, she lived with her biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. She considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
